p: One of the remarkable developments in the energy sector is the decline of coal in electricity generation and its replacement by natural gas and renewable energy, including wind. Across the United States, electric utilities are declaring their intentions to fully convert to renewable energy, often in response to mandates such as renewable portfolio standards. Many state governments have announced plans to decarbonize their electricity grids over the next two decades completely. In addition, many companies such as Amazon, Microsoft, and Google that have energy-intensive cloud computing businesses have signed long-term contracts for the purchase of renewable energy for their facilities. Native American tribal governments are also embracing renewable energy even though many have substantial fossil fuel deposits. For example, although the Navajo Nation derived substantial revenue and employment from coal power generation, with the closure of this facility, it is increasing its investments in solar energy [5].
